caption:
A Will GUARANTEES your family will be going to court for probate ⚖️

I spent yesterday morning at the annual Probate and Guardianship Conference at the new courthouse.

Probate is when someone passes away and the court decides what happens to what they’ve left behind.

While Guardianship is when someone is deemed to be unable to make their own decisions and the court appoints a guardian — this involves minors and those with memory loss issues like dementia.

So many people think that if you have a will, that’s enough. A will GUARANTEES that you will go through probate — all of which becomes public record and can involve a lot more taxes.

There were judges at the conference from Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach counties.

In Broward, the probate division is seeing a 40% increase in filings year-over-year while there hasn’t been a budget for a new probate judge since 2000-2002.

The judges GENUINELY care about doing a great job and want this process to be better but they are COMPLETELY overloaded.

That’s just another reason to avoid ever having to go through probate.

The conversations at the conference heavily focused around the transfer of property because SO MANY probates (last stats I’ve seen say 70%) probates involve property.

Legacies aren’t built when everything is good — it’s built in how the lows are prepared for.
